Package net.regsirius06.engine.point

Class Point

java.lang.Object
net.regsirius06.engine.point.Point
Direct Known Subclasses:
ColoredPoint, Player
public class Point extends Object
The Point class represents a point in a 2D space with x and y coordinates. This class provides methods to perform geometric operations such as calculating distance and angle between two points, as well as copying and comparing points.

      public <P extends Point> boolean isPointInside(@NotNull P p)
      Checks if a given point p is inside this point's location by comparing its coordinates.
      Type Parameters:
      P - the type of the point, which must extend Point
      Parameters:
      p - the point to compare
      Returns:
      true if the coordinates of p are equal to this point, false otherwise

      Parameters:
      x - the x coordinate of the point to compare
      y - the y coordinate of the point to compare
      Returns:

    • angleTo

      public double angleTo(double x, double y)
      Calculates the angle from this point to another point specified by x and y coordinates. The angle is measured in radians, with positive angles indicating counterclockwise rotation and negative angles indicating clockwise rotation from the positive x-axis.
      Parameters:
      x - the x coordinate of the target point
      y - the y coordinate of the target point
      Returns:
      the angle in radians from this point to the specified point

    • angleTo

      public <P extends Point> double angleTo(@NotNull P p)
      Calculates the angle from this point to another point. The angle is measured in radians, with positive angles indicating counterclockwise rotation and negative angles indicating clockwise rotation from the positive x-axis.
      Type Parameters:
      P - the type of the point, which must extend Point
      Parameters:
      p - the target point
      Returns:
      the angle in radians from this point to the specified point

    • movePoint

      public Point movePoint(@NotNull @NotNull Point point)
      Moves the current point by the coordinates of another point. Returns a new point with the new location.
      Parameters:
      point - the point to move by
      Returns:
      a new Point located at the current point moved by the given point's coordinates

    • movePoint

      public Point movePoint(double x, double y)
      Moves the current point by the given x and y offsets. Returns a new point with the new location.
      Parameters:
      x - the x offset to move by
      y - the y offset to move by
      Returns:
      a new Point located at the current point moved by the given offsets

    • equals

      public boolean equals(Object o)
      Checks if this point is equal to another object. Two points are considered equal if their x and y coordinates are the same.
      Overrides:
      equals in class Object
      Parameters:
      o - the object to compare this point to
      Returns:
      true if the object is a point with the same coordinates as this point, false otherwise

    • hashCode

      public int hashCode()
      Returns a hash code for this point. The hash code is based on the x and y coordinates.
